head.title: QUICK BITE | Bedford; Still Catering to Food Fanciers

hedline.hl1: QUICK BITE | Bedford; Still Catering to Food Fanciers

abstract.p: Alice Gabriel reviews Bedford Gourmet sandwich and gourmet shop in Bedford Village, NY (Quick Bite column) (S)

block.p: The ''gourmet'' in the name seems almost quaint, but in 1979, when Mona Spilo opened Bedford Gourmet across from the single-screen movie theater in Bedford Village, Cuisinart was not yet a household word. The shop is the size of some walk-in closets in town, and on busy days customers looking for a special cheese, or maybe just a bit of conversation, are apt to bump quite literally into somebody they know.

With daffodils pushing through the grass and woolens relegated to the mothballs, it's time for lunch on the local green. Chicken salad sandwich, check; cold cream soda, check; small bag of potato chips, check; it's the school lunch you always wanted but your mother never packed. At Bedford Gourmet, half sandwiches ($3.95) include ham and brie with Champagne mustard on black bread, and turkey with cranberry mayonnaise on eight-grain bread. An old-fashioned egg salad sandwich on seven-grain bread will set you back $6.95. Mini-baguettes ($3.95) are filled with mozzarella, basil pesto and roasted tomatoes, or prosciutto, provolone and artichoke-lemon pesto. Delicious celery rémoulade, so much better than coleslaw, is $9.95 per pound.

If a paper bag is just too plain, buy a slatted basket ($30) and fill it with little extras: a bundle of pink and green Caspari napkins, a slim baguette, cipolline onions steeped in balsamic vinegar, a few slices of Fra'Mani salame, a local ''Little Bloom'' goat cheese or a jar of Killer Bee Honey from Tom Cohn's industrious Bedford bees.

The shelves abound with sweets. A one-pound tin of red and black licorice piglets is $12.95 and will last you a month. Tate's butterscotch pecan cookies, stacked in crisp cellophane, are $5.95 a dozen. Petit fours iced with ribbons and daisies are $2.50 each.
Bedford Gourmet, Arcade Building, Route 22, Bedford Village. (914) 234-9409.
